contents.value:
Ray and Max had initially set a budget of $40 
for their adventures this month. 
However, after spending $33, they discovered a new limited edition game they both wanted for $25.
 With just $7 left, they'll go over budget by $18 if they buy it.
 How can they adjust or review their budget?
Buy the game and spend $18 over budget
Adjust their budget by cutting other expenses to accommodate the game
Save the $7 for future adventures and skip the game this month
Borrow money from a friend to buy the game

data.context: If unsure, ask Greenline for advice
data.text: Hey Greenline, i am 8 years old, I have categorized my expenses as fixed, variable and periodic.if I want to save 20% as per the golden rule of budgeting how can I decide which expenses I can avoid?
